entities.description: "Three senior Israeli officials confirmed the broad outlines of the talks, indicating their involvement in diplomatic discussions."
"An Iranian official is involved in the talks, confirming the broad outlines of the discussions."
"A U.S. official is involved in the talks, confirming the broad outlines of the discussions."
"The United States is involved in indirect talks with Iran, reflecting a resumption of diplomacy."

Iran, also known as the Islamic Republic, is a country that has been in negotiations with the U.S., aiming to limit its nuclear program, release imprisoned Americans, and ease nuclear tensions. These negotiations are part of a larger U.S. effort to reduce the risk of a military confrontation.
"Oman is the Gulf Arab state where some indirect talks between the United States and Iran occurred this spring."
"South Korea has a national program to cut emissions and process its food waste into fuel, feed, and fertilizer."
"Ukraine is the recipient of U.S. aid, with future assistance being questioned due to spending caps set by the debt limit bill."
"Kyiv is the capital of Ukraine, where future U.S. assistance is being questioned due to spending caps set by the debt limit bill."
"The Southern Baptist Convention held an annual meeting where delegates voted that only men can be pastors or elders in its churches."
"New Yorkers gathered on the shores of the East River to hear floating musicians taking advantage of the unique acoustics of a drainage tunnel."
"Over 700 workers in Coventry, England, wanted to start the first recognized Amazon union in Britain, but the application was pulled back."
"American officials are involved in discussions about the release of prisoners and call it an urgent U.S. priority."
"The Gulf Arab state is a region where indirect talks between the United States and Iran have occurred."
"Las Vegas is the city where the Golden Knights, a hockey team, became popular and won the Stanley Cup."
"The Golden Knights are a Las Vegas-based hockey team that became the toast of the town and Stanley Cup champs."
"The Stanley Cup is a championship event in which the Golden Knights became the winners."
"The annual meeting of the Southern Baptist Convention where a vote took place to restrict pastoral roles to men."
"New Yorkers gathered to listen to floating musicians on the shores of the East River, taking advantage of the unique acoustics."
"Amazon is a company where over 700 workers in Coventry, England, attempted to start the first recognized union."
"The event of over 700 workers in Coventry, England, attempting to start the first recognized Amazon union, which was pulled back."

relationships.description: "Both Israeli and Iranian officials are involved in the confirmed talks, indicating a diplomatic relationship."

"The U.S. provides aid to Kyiv, which is now being questioned due to spending caps."

"American officials represent the United States in discussions about the release of prisoners."

"The Southern Baptist Convention held an annual meeting where they voted on restricting pastoral roles to men."
"New Yorkers gathered on the shores of the East River to experience unique acoustics."
"Amazon is the company for which over 700 workers in Coventry, England, attempted to start the first recognized union."

entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper, providing news and articles on various topics."
"New York is the location where The New York Times Company is based and where this edition of the newspaper was published."
"Ohio is the location of a European-owned plant mentioned in the article, which is involved in uranium enrichment."
"Piketon is the location in Ohio where the uranium enrichment facility is situated."
"Appalachian valley is the region where the uranium enrichment facility is located."
"Max Bearak is the author of the article discussing the uranium enrichment and its implications on the war in Ukraine and America's energy transition."
"The Pentagon is mentioned as a comparison for the size of the uranium enrichment facility in Piketon, Ohio."
"The United States is the country that is reliant on nuclear power and is paying Russia for uranium to fuel its nuclear power plants."
"Russia is the country from which the United States is buying enriched uranium for its nuclear power plants, despite ongoing war and efforts to sever economic ties."
"Rosatom is Russia's state-owned nuclear agency to which the United States is paying for enriched uranium."
"Ukraine is the country where the war has implications on the United States' predicament regarding uranium enrichment and its reliance on Russian fuel."
"The European-owned plant in Ohio is involved in uranium enrichment but currently yields much less than the U.S. nuclear industry needs."
"Donald J. Trump is the former President whose handling of classified material is under inquiry, with his allies potentially becoming prosecution witnesses."
"Alan Feuer is one of the authors of the article about the inquiry into former President Donald J. Trump's handling of classified material."
"Maggie Haberman is one of the authors of the article about the inquiry into former President Donald J. Trump's handling of classified material."
"Glenn Thrush is one of the authors of the article about the inquiry into former President Donald J. Trump's handling of classified material."
"Mar-a-Lago is the location of Mr. Trump's insular world where intrigue and anxiety are prevalent during the inquiry into his handling of classified material."
"Bedminster, N.J. is the location of Mr. Trump's summer residence where the pressure on his inner circle has increased."
"Walt Nauta is Mr. Trump's personal aide and co-defendant in the case where he is prohibited from discussing the case with Mr. Trump directly."
"Robert Gottlieb was an illustrious editor at Simon & Schuster, Alfred A. Knopf, and The New Yorker, shaping the works of many acclaimed writers."
"event"

"Russia’s state-owned nuclear agency is the entity to which American companies pay around $1 billion a year for enriched uranium, which generates more than half of the United States’ emissions-free energy."
"Subsidiaries of Rosatom receive payments for enriched uranium from the United States and are closely intertwined with Russia’s military apparatus."

"The Soviet Union is historically referenced as the country whose collapse led to a deal with Russia to promote its peaceful nuclear program, enabling Russia to corner half the global market for enriched uranium."
"Trump’s allies are mentioned in the context of the former President's federal indictment, with some potentially becoming prosecution witnesses."
"Members of Trump's Secret Service detail are among those from whom Mr. Trump is prohibited from discussing his case, adding to the complexity of his situation."
"The federal magistrate judge in Miami ordered Mr. Trump not to discuss the case with his co-defendant and personal aide, Walt Nauta, and to limit discussions with potential witnesses."
"Robert D. McFadden is the author of the obituary for Robert Gottlieb, providing details about his illustrious career as an editor."
"Maria is Robert Gottlieb's wife, who confirmed his death."
"John le Carré is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Toni Morrison is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"John Cheever is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Joseph Heller is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Doris Lessing is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Chaim Potok is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Michael Crichton is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Ray Bradbury is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Antonia Fraser is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Barbara Tuchman is one of the many acclaimed writers whose works were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Bill Clinton is a former President whose memoirs were edited by Robert Gottlieb."
"Knopf is a publishing company where Mr. Gottlieb became president and editor in chief."
"The New Yorker is a high-profile magazine in American journalism where Mr. Gottlieb was named the third editor."
"William Shawn was the legendary editor of The New Yorker for 35 years, succeeded by Mr. Gottlieb."
"Harold Ross was the founding editor of The New Yorker."
"S.I. Newhouse Jr. is the person who appointed Mr. Gottlieb as the editor of The New Yorker, and his family owned the magazine."
"Aileen M. Cannon is the Federal District Court judge assigned to preside over former President Donald J. Trump's classified documents case."
"Donald J. Trump is the former President whose classified documents case is presided over by Judge Aileen M. Cannon."
"Federal District Court is where Judge Aileen M. Cannon has been assigned to preside over cases, including Trump's classified documents case."
"F.B.I. is the agency whose court-approved search of Trump's Florida home and club, Mar-a-Lago, was challenged by a lawsuit overseen by Judge Cannon."
"Julie O’Sullivan is a Georgetown University criminal law professor and former federal prosecutor who commented on Judge Cannon's inexperience and potential bias."
"Federal Reserve is the central bank that has been raising interest rates to control inflation."

Iran, also known as the Islamic Republic, is a country that has been in negotiations with the U.S., aiming to limit its nuclear program, release imprisoned Americans, and ease nuclear tensions. These negotiations are part of a larger U.S. effort to reduce the risk of a military confrontation.
"Oman is the Gulf Arab state where some indirect talks between the U.S. and Iran occurred."
"Russia is the country to which Iran supplies drones for use in Ukraine."
"Ukraine is the country where Iran's supplied drones are being used by Russia."
"Charlie Savage is a journalist who co-authored the article about Judge Aileen M. Cannon's role in the Trump classified documents case."
"Bloomberg Law is the provider of a database that lists 224 criminal cases assigned to Judge Aileen M. Cannon."
"New York Times is the newspaper that reviewed the cases assigned to Judge Aileen M. Cannon, identifying four that went to trial."
"Georgetown University is the institution where Julie O’Sullivan is a criminal law professor."
"Jeanna Smialek is the journalist who wrote the article about the Federal Reserve's decision to leave interest rates unchanged."
"Michael Crowley is one of the journalists who reported on the U.S. and Iran's quiet discussions to ease nuclear tensions."
"Farnaz Fassihi is a journalist involved in covering the U.S.-Iran negotiations aimed at limiting Tehran's nuclear program."
"Ronen Bergman is a journalist who contributed to the article about the U.S. and Iran's discussions on easing nuclear tensions."
"U.S. goal refers to the objective of reaching an informal agreement with Iran to limit its nuclear program and free imprisoned Americans."
"Political cease-fire is the term used by some Iranian officials to describe the potential informal, unwritten agreement between the U.S. and Iran."
"Mar-a-Lago is the Florida home and club of former President Donald J. Trump, which was subject to an F.B.I. search."
